Intervention: - Load dose of cetuximab 400 mg/m^2 and then 250 mg/m^2 per week + ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 every 3 weeks
Eligibility: Female subjects with locally advanced non-resectable and/or metastatic triple negative breast cancer (ER, PR, and HER2 negative)
Previous chemotherapy with adjuvant or neoadjuvant anthracycline
Tumours that are positive or immunohistochemical (IHC) in situ fluorescence hybridization (FISH) tests 3+
Previous systemic treatment for metastatic diseases
Results: Percentage of participants with an objective response (OR; using the criteria for assessing responses in solid tumours [RECIST])
The confidence interval (CI) was calculated using the Clopper-Pearson method.
Timeline: Evaluation every 6 weeks during the first 12 months of randomization thereafter every 3 months until disease progression (maximum objective response of participants of 18.3 weeks)
Title of the arm/group: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2
Description of the arm/group: ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 every 3 weeks
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 30.0 (16.6 to 46.5)
Title of the arm/group: Cetuximab 250 mg/m^2 + Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2
Description of the arm/group: cetuximab 400 mg/m^2 loading dose followed by 250 mg/m^2 per week + ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 every 3 weeks
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 35.9 (21.2-52.8)
